intro: Gagea amblyopetala var. depauperata, commonly known as the slender gagea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its small, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, rounded berries that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
